info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 2:49AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Henderson, southwestern Rock Island, Mercer, western Henry, northern Henry, northern Des Moines, Louisa, southeastern Washington, southern Muscatine and northeastern Jefferson Counties through 330 AM CDT... At 248 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Illinois City to near Wyman to Abingdon. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Muscatine, Aledo, Wapello, Columbus Junction, Mediapolis, Winfield, Fruitland, Wayland, Morning Sun, Millersburg, Matherville, New Boston, Brighton, Sherrard, Keithsburg, Grandview, Reynolds, Eliza, Joy and Columbus City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
